node.title: Is Max Verstappen F1 world champion or not? It could take days to know for sure
node.alt: A man wearing a cap holds up an F1 trophy
node.description: Team Mercedes is appealing Max Verstappen's last-lap victory in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. It could be days before we know for sure whether his world title will be taken off him or not.
node.content:
["A dramatic end to the Formula 1 season is set to continue well after the engines have cooled, with Mercedes pursuing a complex appeal to Red Bull and Max Verstappen's last-lap win.\u00a0", "Former world champion Lewis Hamilton's Mercedes team lodged two protests, which were dismissed, but they're not giving up that easily, taking their appeal to the sport's highest ruling body.\u00a0", "Verstappen and Hamilton entered the final race on equal points, so it was always going to be a tight final contest \u2014 but Mercedes is arguing that a fair outcome was taken out of Hamilton's hands due to a last-minute call by the race director.", "Here's what we know about the process from here.", "
What happened that sparked all this drama?
", "Mercedes lodged two protests \u2014 one was over whether\u00a0Verstappen had broken rules by overtaking Hamilton during a safety car period while debris from a crash was being cleared.", "Stewards dismissed that one because even though there was a \"short period of time\" where Verstappen moved slightly in front of Hamilton, \"it\u00a0was not in front when the Safety Car period ended\".\u00a0", "The\u00a0other was about the number of lapped drivers that overtook the safety car.", "", "
Max Verstappen hasn't let the appeals drama get in the way of his celebrations.(AP: Kamran Jebreili)
", "Initially, the decision made by the race director was taken not to let lapped cars overtake the safety car, which would have meant several drivers would have been in Verstappen's way at the restart and made it more difficult to reach Hamilton over one lap.", "But\u00a0that decision was changed at the last minute \u2014 five drivers who were originally between Verstappen and Hamilton overtook, and three didn't.", "Mercedes argued Hamilton would have won the race if all had overtaken the safety car due to the time required, making a final lap showdown impossible, but stewards ruled that it made no difference since the other three were not interfering with the outcome of the race.", "
What happens from here?\u00a0
", "After both its protests were initially dismissed by race stewards,\u00a0Mercedes filed for reconsideration to the International Court of Appeal.", "That's the\u00a0F\u00e9d\u00e9ration Internationale de l'Automobile's (FIA) highest appeal tribunal, and is an\u00a0independent body with 36 members from all over the world\u00a0which \"resolves disputes brought before it by any of motor sport\u2019s National Sporting Authorities worldwide\".\u00a0", "They'll consider the appeal and make a judgement.", "That could take up to a few days, but it can't drag on forever \u2014 we should know the verdict before the World Championship trophy is officially presented at a ceremony in Paris on December 16.", "
Who's in the wrong?
", "Freelance F1 reporter Chris Medland\u00a0told ABC News that it was not the fault of either of the drivers\u00a0\u2014 the decisions around safety cars and restarting the race were made by Australian race director Michael Masi.", "\"In a sense, neither driver and neither team did anything wrong. It was just the cards they were dealt and had to play with that Mercedes are very unhappy about,\" he says.", "\"The way the regulations are written, it looks like you shouldn't be able to only let some cars unlap themselves, it should be that the whole field does or nobody does and when they do, you wait another lap before you restart the race. Instead, the race restarted instantly.", "\"There's all these technicalities in the rules that Mercedes are basically arguing weren't followed. And the way it looks, it looks like they weren't \u2014 but that's not Red Bull's fault.\"\u00a0", "Regardless of whether they're team Mercedes, team Red Bull or otherwise, many F1 fans have expressed their disappointment with Masi's decision about the lapped cars' overtaking, which they believe impacted the outcome of the race.", "
What have the drivers said about all this?
", "Very little\u00a0at this stage.", "Verstappen didn't really go into detail, only saying this about the protests\u00a0at a post-race press conference:", "Verstappen did, however, say he \"really enjoyed\" the battle between himself and Lewis Hamilton for the world championship, while admitting it had been \"tense\".", "\"You know, we had our moments, but I think in a championship battle, that\u2019s part of it,\" he said.", "", "
Max Verstappen was overcome with emotion when he realised he'd won.(Reuters:\u00a0Hamad I Mohammed)
", "\u00a0\"The competition, almost every race we have been pushing each other to the limit, within our cars as well. And I think that is just really nice to see.\"", "Hamilton also briefly spoke to media after the race, praising his team and congratulating Verstappen on his win.", "\"It has been the most difficult of seasons,\" he said.", "\"I\u2019m so proud of (the team),\u00a0so grateful to be part of the journey with them. We gave it everything.\"", "ABC/wires"]
